channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Climate change: At-risk nations fear extinction after IPCC report
item.description: The most vulnerable developing countries plead for action after a stark warning from a UN panel.

item.title: China: Canadian citizen loses appeal against death penalty
item.description: The verdict comes as an extradition battle in Canada for Huawei executive Meng Wanzhou continues.

item.title: Greece fires: PM apologises as blazes rage on Evia island
item.description: Kyriakos Mitsotakis says Greece is facing an unprecedented natural disaster, as public anger grows.

item.title: Andrew Cuomo: Time's Up leader resigns over ties to governor
item.description: Roberta Kaplan was accused of trying to discredit a woman who said Mr Cuomo had harassed her.

item.title: Princess Latifa: Campaign to free Dubai ruler's daughter disbanded
item.description: The Dubai ruler's daughter was pictured in Iceland after accusing her father of keeping her captive.

item.title: Virginia Giuffre: Prince Andrew accuser files civil case in US
item.description: Virginia Giuffre alleges the Duke of York sexually assaulted her when she was 17 years old.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence may diagnose dementia in a day
item.description: The system being tested should spot the disease long before symptoms or obvious brain signs develop.

item.title: Mexican drug cartel threatens to kill TV reporter
item.description: In a video featuring heavily armed men the prominent female journalist is accused of unfair coverage.

item.title: Marburg virus: Man who died in Guinea found to have disease
item.description: A man who died is found to have had the highly infectious virus, the first human case in West Africa.

item.title: China elephants: 150,000 evacuated from path of trekking herd
item.description: The herd is finally headed for home after an extraordinary 17-month migration in Yunnan province.

item.title: Lionel Messi agrees Paris St-Germain deal after Barcelona exit - Guillem Balague
item.description: Lionel Messi agrees a two-year deal with Paris St-Germain to join the French club, says BBC Sport columnist Guillem Balague.

item.title: TikTok named as the most downloaded app of 2020
item.description: The Chinese app's popularity comes even after former President Donald Trump tried to ban it in the US.

item.title: Biden's unlikely plan to use roads to fight racism
item.description: An infrastructure package that seeks to address inequality gets a mixed reception on the ground.

item.title: Olympic medals: An alternative table - with US 15th
item.description: How would the medals table look if population and wealth were taken into account?

item.title: Afghanistan: Why is there a war?
item.description: As foreign forces pull out after 20 years of war, what did it achieve and what happens next?

item.title: Why South Korean women are reclaiming their short hair
item.description: Thousands proudly show off their short hair after an Olympic athlete is criticised for her haircut.

item.title: Climate change: Five things we have learned from the IPCC report
item.description: What are the key takeaways from the IPCC new study on the science of climate change?

item.title: Malta: The teenagers pulled from the sea and accused of terrorism
item.description: How three teenagers rescued from the Mediterranean Sea ended up in Malta accused of terrorism.

item.title: Fashion photographer: 'The world doesn't see this part of Afghanistan'
item.description: Fatimah Hossaini is a fashion photographer in Afghanistan and wants to use her work to help women be seen.

item.title: Greece wildfires: 'It's like a horror movie but it's real life'
item.description: Thousands of people have had to evacuate Greece's second biggest island as severe wildfires rage.

item.title: Lukashenko: 'You can choke on your sanctions in the UK'
item.description: The UK and US are tightening sanctions on Belarus, hitting economic sectors.

item.title: Lionel Messi: Barcelona star in tears as he receives ovation news conference
item.description: Lionel Messi is distraught as he receives a standing ovation from team-mates, journalists, officials and his family at a news conference confirming his departure from Barcelona.

item.title: North Korea floods: Homes destroyed and thousands evacuated
item.description: The state broadcaster says some regions have seen over 50cm (20in) of rain in three days.
